canonical_explanation.text: A shape has symmetry when you can fold it along a line and both halves match exactly. This fold line is called the line of symmetry. Many shapes and objects have symmetry — a circle, a square, a rectangle, a butterfly, and a leaf are all symmetrical. Patterns are arrangements that repeat in a predictable way. In a repeating pattern, a group of items (like shapes or colours) repeats over and over (e.g., red, blue, red, blue). In a growing pattern, the numbers or items increase by the same amount each time (e.g., 2, 4, 6, 8).
rules: A line of symmetry divides a shape into two matching halves.
If you fold a shape along the line of symmetry, both halves fit exactly on top of each other.
A circle, square, and rectangle are symmetrical shapes.
A butterfly and a leaf are examples of symmetrical objects from nature.
In a repeating pattern, the same group repeats (AB, AB, AB or ABC, ABC).
In a growing pattern, numbers increase by the same amount (e.g., +2, +3, +5, +10).
To find the next item in a pattern, look at what repeats or what changes each time.

questions.question_text: What happens when you fold a shape along its line of symmetry?

options.text: One half is bigger than the other

questions.explanation_correct: When you fold along the line of symmetry, both halves match exactly — they fit perfectly on top of each other.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The line of symmetry divides a shape into two equal halves that match when folded.

questions.question_text: What is the line that divides a shape into two matching halves called?
questions.explanation_correct: The line that divides a shape into two matching halves is called the line of symmetry.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A line of symmetry splits a shape into two halves that are mirror images of each other.

questions.question_text: If you fold a square in half from top to bottom, do both halves match?
questions.explanation_correct: Yes. A square is symmetrical, and folding it from top to bottom creates two matching rectangles.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A square has a line of symmetry from top to bottom. When folded, both halves match.

questions.question_text: Which of these is a symmetrical shape?

options.text: A shape with one long side and one short side

questions.explanation_correct: A circle is symmetrical — you can fold it along any diameter and both halves match.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A circle has many lines of symmetry. It can be folded in many ways with both halves matching.

questions.question_text: Which object from nature is symmetrical?
questions.explanation_correct: A butterfly has a line of symmetry down the middle — the left wing matches the right wing.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A butterfly has matching left and right wings, making it symmetrical.

questions.question_text: Which of these shapes is symmetrical?

options.text: A shape with all sides different

questions.explanation_correct: A rectangle is symmetrical — it can be folded in half both ways and the halves match.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A rectangle has lines of symmetry. You can fold it from top to bottom or left to right and both halves match.

questions.question_text: True or False: A leaf has a line of symmetry.
questions.explanation_correct: True. Most leaves have a line of symmetry down the middle — the left half matches the right half.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Most leaves can be folded down the middle vein, and both halves match approximately.

questions.question_text: True or False: A square is symmetrical.
questions.explanation_correct: True. A square has lines of symmetry — you can fold it in half and both halves match.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A square can be folded along the middle (vertically, horizontally, or diagonally) and both halves match.

questions.question_text: What comes next in this pattern: red, blue, red, blue, red, ___?
questions.explanation_correct: The pattern is red, blue repeating. After red, the next colour is blue.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is a repeating AB pattern: red (A), blue (B), red (A), blue (B)... After red, blue comes next.

questions.question_text: What comes next: circle, square, circle, square, circle, ___?
questions.explanation_correct: The pattern repeats: circle, square, circle, square. After circle, square comes next.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is a repeating AB pattern. Circle (A), Square (B) repeat. After circle, square is next.

questions.question_text: What comes next: triangle, triangle, circle, triangle, triangle, circle, triangle, triangle, ___?
questions.explanation_correct: The pattern is AAB: triangle, triangle, circle. After two triangles, a circle comes next.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The repeating group is: triangle, triangle, circle (AAB). After two triangles, the pattern calls for a circle.

questions.question_text: What comes next in this growing pattern: 2, 4, 6, 8, ___?
questions.explanation_correct: The pattern grows by 2 each time: 2, 4, 6, 8, 10.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Each number is 2 more than the previous one: 2+2=4, 4+2=6, 6+2=8, 8+2=10.

questions.question_text: What comes next: 5, 10, 15, 20, ___?
questions.explanation_correct: The pattern grows by 5 each time: 5, 10, 15, 20, 25.

questions.question_text: What comes next: A, B, C, A, B, C, A, ___?
questions.explanation_correct: The pattern repeats ABC: A, B, C, A, B, C, A, B.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The repeating group is A, B, C. After A, the next in the group is B.

questions.question_text: Aarav folds a rectangle in half from left to right. Do both halves match?

options.text: Only if the rectangle is big
Only if the rectangle is small

questions.explanation_correct: Yes. A rectangle has a vertical line of symmetry. Folding from left to right gives two matching halves.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A rectangle can be folded left to right, and both halves are identical. This fold line is a line of symmetry.

questions.question_text: Which of these is NOT symmetrical?
questions.explanation_correct: The letter J is not symmetrical — if you fold it, the two halves do not match.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The letters J, F, G, P, etc. are not symmetrical. Shapes like circle, square, and rectangle are symmetrical.

questions.question_text: What comes next: star, heart, star, heart, star, ___?
questions.explanation_correct: The pattern alternates: star, heart, star, heart. After star, heart comes next.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The repeating pattern is star, heart (AB). After star (A), heart (B) is next.

questions.question_text: What comes next: 10, 20, 30, 40, ___?
questions.explanation_correct: The pattern grows by 10 each time: 10, 20, 30, 40, 50.

questions.question_text: Find the missing shape: circle, square, triangle, circle, ___, triangle
questions.explanation_correct: The pattern repeats: circle, square, triangle. The missing shape is square.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The repeating group is circle, square, triangle (ABC). The missing one in the second group is square (B).

questions.question_text: Kavya drew a heart shape. She says it has a line of symmetry down the middle. Is she correct?

options.text: Yes, both halves match when folded
No, a heart has no symmetry
Only if the heart is very big

questions.explanation_correct: Yes. A heart shape has a vertical line of symmetry — the left half and right half are mirror images.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A heart can be folded down the middle, and both halves match. It has a line of symmetry.

questions.question_text: What comes next: 1, 3, 5, 7, ___?
questions.explanation_correct: The pattern grows by 2 each time: 1, 3, 5, 7, 9.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Each number is 2 more than the previous one: 1+2=3, 3+2=5, 5+2=7, 7+2=9.

questions.question_text: Which letter has a line of symmetry?
questions.explanation_correct: The letter A has a vertical line of symmetry — the left and right halves match.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The letter A can be split down the middle into two matching halves. Letters F, G, and R are not symmetrical.

questions.explanation_correct: The pattern repeats: 1, 1, 2. After 1, 1, the next number is 2.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The repeating group is 1, 1, 2 (AAB). After 1, 1, the pattern gives 2.

questions.question_text: True or False: A circle has a line of symmetry.
questions.explanation_correct: True. A circle has many lines of symmetry — any line through the centre divides it into two matching halves.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A circle can be folded in half along any diameter, and both halves match every time.

questions.question_text: Fill in the blank: 3, 6, 9, ___, 15
questions.explanation_correct: The pattern grows by 3 each time: 3, 6, 9, 12, 15.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Each number increases by 3: 3+3=6, 6+3=9, 9+3=12, 12+3=15.

questions.question_text: Find the repeating group in this pattern: red, green, blue, red, green, blue, red, green, blue.
questions.explanation_correct: The repeating group is: red, green, blue (ABC pattern).
questions.explanation_incorrect: The group that repeats is red, green, blue. It appears 3 times in the pattern.

questions.question_text: Priya folds different shapes. Which shape will NOT have matching halves when folded down the middle?
questions.explanation_correct: A shape with unequal sides (irregular shape) will not have matching halves when folded.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Circle, square, and rectangle all have lines of symmetry. An irregular shape with unequal sides does not.

questions.question_text: Which of these objects is symmetrical?
questions.explanation_correct: A pair of glasses (front view) has a vertical line of symmetry — the left side mirrors the right side.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Glasses viewed from the front have matching left and right sides. A shoe, cloud, and tree branch are not symmetrical.

questions.question_text: What is the rule in this pattern: 4, 8, 12, 16, 20?
questions.explanation_correct: Each number increases by 4: 4+4=8, 8+4=12, 12+4=16, 16+4=20. The rule is add 4.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The difference between each pair is 4: 8-4=4, 12-8=4, 16-12=4, 20-16=4. The rule is +4.

questions.question_text: What comes next: square, circle, circle, square, circle, circle, square, ___?
questions.explanation_correct: The pattern repeats: square, circle, circle (ABB). After square, circle is next.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The repeating group is square, circle, circle. After square, the first circle in the group comes next.

questions.question_text: A triangle with all sides equal is folded from top to bottom along the middle. Do the halves match?

options.text: Only if the triangle is big
Only if the triangle is small

questions.explanation_correct: Yes. An equilateral triangle (all sides equal) has a line of symmetry from the top vertex to the middle of the bottom side.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A triangle with all equal sides can be folded along a line from the top corner to the middle of the base, and both halves match.

questions.question_text: Which of these English letters is symmetrical?
questions.explanation_correct: The letter M has a vertical line of symmetry — the left and right halves match.
questions.explanation_incorrect: M can be split down the middle into matching halves. B has a horizontal line of symmetry, P and Q do not have clear symmetry.

questions.question_text: What is the missing number: 10, 8, 6, ___, 2?
questions.explanation_correct: The pattern decreases by 2 each time: 10, 8, 6, 4, 2.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Each number decreases by 2: 10-2=8, 8-2=6, 6-2=4, 4-2=2.

questions.question_text: Fill in the blank: In the pattern red, blue, yellow, red, blue, ___, the missing colour is:
questions.explanation_correct: The repeating group is red, blue, yellow. The missing colour is yellow.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The pattern repeats: red, blue, yellow (ABC). After red, blue, the next is yellow.

questions.question_text: True or False: If you fold a shape and both halves do NOT match, the shape has no line of symmetry along that fold.
questions.explanation_correct: True. If both halves do not match when folded, the fold line is not a line of symmetry.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A line of symmetry must produce two matching halves. If they don't match, that line is not a line of symmetry.

questions.question_text: What comes next: 50, 45, 40, 35, ___?
questions.explanation_correct: The pattern decreases by 5 each time: 50, 45, 40, 35, 30.

questions.question_text: What comes next: up, down, up, down, up, ___?
questions.explanation_correct: The pattern alternates: up, down, up, down. After up, down comes next.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is an AB repeating pattern. Up (A), down (B) alternate. After up, down is next.

questions.question_text: True or False: A triangle with all sides equal is symmetrical.
questions.explanation_correct: True. An equilateral triangle (all sides equal) has lines of symmetry.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A triangle with all sides equal can be folded so both halves match — it has symmetry.

questions.question_text: Fill in the blank: 20, 18, 16, ___, 12
questions.explanation_correct: The pattern decreases by 2: 20, 18, 16, 14, 12.

questions.question_text: When we fold a shape along its line of symmetry, both halves are called:
questions.explanation_correct: Both halves are mirror images of each other — they look exactly the same but flipped.
questions.explanation_incorrect: When folded along the line of symmetry, the two halves are mirror images — they match perfectly.

questions.question_text: Fill in the blank: In the pattern big, small, big, small, big, the next is ___.
questions.explanation_correct: The pattern alternates: big, small. After big, the next is small.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Big and small alternate (AB pattern). After big, small comes next.

questions.question_text: Which of these has a line of symmetry?
questions.explanation_correct: The letter T has a vertical line of symmetry — the left half matches the right half.
questions.explanation_incorrect: T can be split vertically into two matching halves. S, Z, and N do not have a simple line of symmetry.

questions.question_text: What is the rule in this pattern: 100, 90, 80, 70, 60?
questions.explanation_correct: Each number decreases by 10: 100-10=90, 90-10=80, etc. The rule is subtract 10.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The difference between consecutive numbers is 10 (decreasing): 100, 90, 80, 70, 60. Rule: subtract 10.

questions.question_text: In the pattern: clap, clap, stomp, clap, clap, stomp, clap, clap, ___, what comes next?
questions.explanation_correct: The repeating group is: clap, clap, stomp (AAB). After clap, clap, stomp comes next.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The pattern repeats in groups of 3: clap, clap, stomp. After the second clap, stomp follows.

questions.question_text: Siya draws half of a butterfly on one side of a line. To complete the butterfly, she should:

options.text: Draw a different shape on the other side
Draw the same half as a mirror image on the other side
Draw a circle on the other side

questions.explanation_correct: To complete the symmetrical butterfly, she should draw a mirror image of the first half on the other side of the line.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A butterfly is symmetrical. The other half should be a mirror image of the first half.

questions.question_text: What comes next: 2, 5, 8, 11, ___?
questions.explanation_correct: The pattern grows by 3 each time: 2, 5, 8, 11, 14.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Each number increases by 3: 2+3=5, 5+3=8, 8+3=11, 11+3=14.

questions.question_text: Which of these objects has a line of symmetry?
questions.explanation_correct: An arrow pointing up has a vertical line of symmetry — the left and right sides match.
questions.explanation_incorrect: An upward-pointing arrow can be split vertically into two matching halves.

questions.question_text: Fill in the blank: moon, sun, moon, sun, ___, sun
questions.explanation_correct: The pattern alternates: moon, sun, moon, sun, moon, sun. The missing item is moon.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Moon and sun alternate (AB pattern). The missing position is A (moon).

questions.question_text: Fill in the blank: When you fold a symmetrical shape along its line of symmetry, both halves ___.
questions.explanation_correct: Both halves match exactly when a symmetrical shape is folded along its line of symmetry.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The definition of a line of symmetry is that folding along it makes both halves match.

questions.question_text: What are the next two numbers: 1, 4, 7, 10, ___, ___?
questions.explanation_correct: The pattern grows by 3: 1, 4, 7, 10, 13, 16.
